Fields.DialogueText: Reporting as ordered, Captain. I have my notes ready for the strategy briefing.
And we're waiting on Atlantis, as usual.
Did you see her on your way here?
I did not, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure she will arrive soon.
I thought we were over this...
Did she say anything to you about it?

Fields.DialogueText: I could not say, Captain. She gave no indication to me about her intentions.
May I ask what you mean by that, Captain?
She spoke nothing of it to me, Captain.
She's gone quiet again.
Captain?
Say nothing of this to the crew, but Atlantis has a history of being... tight-lipped. I'm not certain what she's up to.
The crew actually finds her inspirational. I know that I do.
And we don't want anything to change that.
I appreciate your punctuality, Officer Jin, but let's postpone this brief...
Of course, Captain. I'll take my notes back to my quarters.
*ALARM*
No time for that right now. To the bridge.
Aye-aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
Here she comes. Atlantis, a moment please?
Atlantis, I...
Hello? Did you hear me?
Here she comes again...
Atlantis?

Fields.MenuText: Are you avoiding me again?
You must be busy...
Stop! Stand still!

Fields.DialogueText: Keinesfalls, Kapitän, I assure you.
Entschuldigung, Kapitän.
A few minutes of your time shouldn't be so difficult for the ship's captain to secure.
Pardon me, but I promise that I will be available in just a Moment.
*ALARM*
Can you find some time for THAT?
@BATTLE
A clear horizon, fair weather, and no scheduled events for the ship. Atlantis will need a great excuse to avoid a conversation this time.
Atlantis.
Kapitän.
Well?

Fields.MenuText: I don't like being ignored.
Some might consider your behavior to be... Unprofessional. Perhaps even insubordinate.
I thought we were establishing a better working relationship than this.

Fields.DialogueText: I would not ignore my Kapitän.
I would never wish to encourage that sort of Reputation, Kapitän.
I have no Intention of showing you any disrespect, Kapitän.
My recent Pflichten have kept me occupied.
It's no secret that you work hard, Atlantis. Even so, you seem to be reverting to some old habits.
Inadequate Kommunikation.
That's the one that concerns me.
Ach so. If you have a Moment, I can explain myself-
*ALARM*
All in good time, Atlantis. First things first.
Ich bin bereit.
@BATTLE
Attention on deck!
Am I interrupting anything?
Atlantis was waiting for you to arrive before starting the training session.
Please begin, Atlantis.
Danke, Kapitän.
May I bitten um your attention? Our Training will focus on Schiff configurations and visual identification.
Bitte turn your attention to this chart I have prepared...

Fields.MenuText: (Impressive. She's put a lot of work into this presentation.)
(Interesting. I wonder why she chose this topic?)
(Ugh... I hope some Morganas show up before we all fall asleep!)

Fields.DialogueText: Do not be intimidated by the Diagramme. The concepts are important, but they are simple.
Our mission effectiveness can be enhanced by applying these Konzepte.
Kapitän, would you like some Kaffee? I brewed a fresh Kanne for those who may need some.
The critical idea is simple. We identify other Schiffe by how they look.
We see Flaggen und Farben. We see the shape of the hull. We see other Details as well.
And we use the visual information to tell us friend or foe.
Excellent, Officer Jin. "Freund oder Feind" is one of the most important things to determine, but it is not the only thing.
Consider the following Szenario...
*ALARM*
Sounds like our lookouts decided on "foe."
The training will have to wait, Atlantis.
Natürlich, Kapitän.
Let's get to battle stations!
@BATTLE
Good thinking, Atlantis.
Willkommen zurück.
We still have to do more training? I thought we were done.
We didn't finish last time.
Ugh. I never thought I'd find myself wishing for another Morgana attack.
Did you say something about a Morgana attack?
Oh! Hello, Captain.
We didn't know you were sitting back there.

Fields.MenuText: I hope you have more situational awareness in combat.
I'd like to see a little more respect, as the ship's commanding officer.
I expect you to show more respect for Atlantis and her hard work.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll keep that in mind.
We meant no disrespect, Captain.
I didn't mean to sound ungrateful, Captain! All of us hold Atlantis in high regard.
Conduct yourself accordingly, officers. Ah, here she is.
Tut mir Leid, dich warten zu lassen. Kapitän, ship's officers... let me resume where we left off.
Often, we do not have radio contact or Erkenntnisse to guide our response when we see a Schiff on the water with us.
We must train ourselves to use what we see and quickly assess the Situation.
Gleichzeitig we have to look and think carefully, to avoid fatal mistakes. This Training will help to enable you...
*ALARM*
Morgana contact again? Let's get going.
You have a serious look on your face. Are you all right?
I should heed my own advice and control my äußere appearance.
If it makes you feel any better, you're still tough to read.
I cannot hide my concerns about our last Alarm.
At least there was no combat. It turned out to be a merchant vessel instead of a Morgana.
Trotzdem, I am still unhappy.

Fields.MenuText: It interrupted your training. That can be frustrating.
It was a false alarm. That should be a relief.
I'm concerned as well. Our lookout and our deck officer both made a mistake.

Fields.DialogueText: That does not trouble me, Kapitän. I am more concerned about the Fehler that was made.
But, it could have been terrible. Imagine if we mistook a foe for a friend. Or umgekehrt.
So ist es. They mistook a ziviles Schiff for an enemy. If we had not recognized the mistake rechtzeitig...
I understand. If our lookouts can't correctly identify what they see, we could end up in big trouble.
I would like to reschedule our Training as soon as possible.
I'll see what we can do. Until then, spend some extra time on the bridge helping the lookouts.
Jawohl, Kapitän. I will see what I can teach them.
Don't let us get caught by surprise.
@BATTLE
Our Training continues.
Pay attention, officers.
Aye aye, Captain.
Aye-aye, Captain.
Ships with konventionellen propulsion require a large exhaust from their Kessel. These large structures are quite visible from a Distanz.
Kann any of you tell me the proper Name for this structure?

Fields.MenuText: I'll let Officer Jin answer this one.
I'll let Officer Raleigh answer this one.
It's called a "funnel."

Fields.DialogueText: Officer Jin?
Officer Raleigh?
Genau. Well done, Kapitän.
Ja. The number and Position of funnels, as well as other structures, can be used to classify a Schiff.
Zum Beispiel, we only have one.
Pay close attention, bitte, to my explanation of other telling structures in the Präsentation.
Masten and Kräne, in conjunction with funnels, can create a pattern that, while not einzigartig, can narrow down the identity of a Schiff that is unidentified.
Let us now look at some common Profile from the major Flotten...
*ALARM*
Battle stations, all. And don't forget to study your notes later.
@BATTLE
It's called a "funnel," Atlantis.
Ja. Correct.
A "smokestack?"
Close, but not quite. The proper term is "funnel."
... According to this Royal Navy Handbuch... I found... irgendwo... by chance...
You're in a hole. Maybe stop digging.
I've noticed two things, Atlantis.
You have my attention, Kapitän.
First, you seem slightly more relaxed. I hope that means your training has been successful.
Ich denke schon. It has engaged our lookouts and given them more Details to look for.
Was is the second thing you noticed, Kapitän?
Now I know why you never seemed willing to talk to me.

Fields.MenuText: You were busy preparing your training.
You're still uncomfortable around me.
You're working on a secret project.

Fields.DialogueText: That did occupy a significant amount of my time, but I still have viel zu tun.
I... I am not trying to avoid you, Kapitän. I assure you I have simply been preoccupied with bestimmten Dingen.
Sehr scharfsinnig, Kapitän - though I am not trying to keep anything a secret.
I am trying to enhance our own capabilities. Our Mission and our survival may depend on it.
I see.
If you would please excuse me, Kapitän, I... have matters to attend to.
Carry on, Atlantis.
Something's still not quite right...
@BATTLE
You're worried about something besides training?
Have you seen Atlantis?
I thought she was on the bridge with Officer Raleigh.
Negative, Captain. Our Belle excused herself and headed aft. I thought perhaps she had passed you in the passageway.
Do I detect a bit of concern, Officer Jin?
Perhaps a little bit, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: No need to panic. I'm certain she would tell us if there was a problem.
Did she say anything before she left?
She must be working on something important.

Fields.DialogueText: I am not panicked, Captain. I am simply concerned.
Officer Raleigh didn't say.
That might explain it.
There was one more detail. I heard a report from the deck division that she ordered some equipment moved from storage.
I'll go and investigate it personally.
Yes, Captain. I'll see if Officer Raleigh needs any assistance on the bridge.
Equipment from storage? What is she up to now? First stop is...
*ALARM*
*sigh*
@BATTLE
To the bridge first. But, after this, I need to find out what Atlantis is trying to do.
Let me make sure I understand this, ma'am.
Take your time, and be sure to focus those binoculars.
If I'm seeing this right, it looks like that ship has... a tall mast, then two smokestacks...
Funnels.
Funnels, right. Then another mast. Aft of that, some lifeboat davits and some other gear.
Richtig! Any guesses?
No guns that I can see from here. And the smoke from the stacks...
Funnels.
Funnels, aye. Looks like dark smoke. The hull looks a bit square. An old merchant vessel, if I had to guess.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds like a reasonable guess to me.
Have more confidence.
Are you sure it isn't a sailboat?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh?
I've got plenty of confidence...
Ha! I think I can tell the difference between a damn sailboat and a...
Captain! Sorry - I didn't realize it was you back there.
Don't worry about it. You were looking through those binoculars, and you had no way to tell.
Weggetreten, Seaman Brooks. Oh, and you might want to learn to recognize the sound of the voice of our Kapitän.
Personally training the crew?
The Offiziere are not the only ones who need to recognize Schiff designs.
Is that all that you're doing out here?
For the Moment, Kapitän.
I see. Still not ready to talk about your plans yet?
Zuerst a few more preparations.
Don't keep me waiting too long.
@BATTLE
Good work getting the latest intelligence reports plotted on the chart.
Thanks, Captain. I'm heading back to the radio room, unless you need something else.
No. Dismissed, Officer Raleigh.
Wo ist es? Wo ist es?
Atlantis?
That doesn't sound good.
Es muss doch hier irgendwo sein.....Vielleicht ist es mir aus der Tasche gefallen?
She's lost something important. She keeps looking down at the deck and retracing her steps.
Wo ist meine... Kapitän!

Fields.MenuText: You've already checked this passageway at least twice.
What did you lose? It must be something important.
Need any help?

Fields.DialogueText: You noticed that.
I will find it.
Ja! I mean... Nein! I will... find it myself.
Are you looking for Ferry?
Ferry, our ship's mascot, is not missing. In fact, I fed our Scottish Terrier less than an hour ago... Ferry!
If I wasn't confused before, I am now...
@BATTLE
I did.
I hope it isn't a classified document.
It is not, Kapitän.
Komm! Komm her, Ferry!
*Arf!*
I see you hiding back there. Come out! Komm her! Komm zu mir and I will give you some Leckerli.
What in the world is she doing?
That's it, Ferry. A little closer to me. Komm her...
Und was ist das? In your mouth... You naughty Hund. That belongs to me. Run along now, Ferry.
*Arf!*
*sigh*

Fields.MenuText: Were you having some trouble with our ship's mascot?
Did you find what you were looking for?
Is this really how you spend your time? I'm sure we can find something more important for you to do.

Fields.DialogueText: A little, but... now I can relax.
I... I did, ja.
I did not mean to neglect my other duties, aber es war dringend.
You seem relieved. It must have been something important that you recovered.
Es...
I take it back. Now you look like you're... Do you need a moment?
I... I do.
*ALARM*
We're definitely going to talk about this later.
Jawohl, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
Is that really your order? To inventory the top secret materials safe?
That's right.
I completed the weekly inventory with Officer Raleigh just a few days ago. All of our top secret materials were accounted for...
I just want you to conduct the inventory again.
Was there something wrong with the last inventory? If just one page of paper is missing... that could be a disaster!

Fields.MenuText: Trust me, I understand the significance. That's why I'm trusting you to do a good job.
It's just a random check for extra security.
I saw something suspicious, and I just want to make sure none of our documents are missing.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought I did a good job... last time...
Ah. I see.
Say no more, Captain. I will take care of it.
I will make a report to you as soon as it is completed.
Thank you, Officer Jin.
The last thing I need on board is a thief... I trust Atlantis, but I have to make sure.
*ALARM*
Damn. Bad timing...
@BATTLE
May I enter, Kapitän?
I keep my cabin door unlocked. Come in, Atlantis. Take a seat.
Ich bevorzuge standing, if you do not mind, Kapitän.
Suit yourself. I have a fresh pot of coffee and an open schedule for the next few hours.
I don't...
Just trying to make you comfortable. Since you don't seem like you want to start, I will.

Fields.MenuText: You don't want people to see who you really are, behind the disguises.
I conducted an extra inventory of the top secret safe. Care to say anything about it?
I think I see what's going on, but I'll let you explain it.

Fields.DialogueText: I must admit that I am ashamed.
I saw die Offiziere Jin and Raleigh working with the top secret safe, but I... Oh. Kapitän, I assure you nothing like that is amiss!
I am not trying to keep secrets, but sometimes I feel an urge... mich etwas zu abzuschotten.
You saw me chasing our mascot around the Schiff. I had dropped something, and Ferry had picked it up.
And what was it that was so important? I know it wasn't a top secret document.
Mein Anhänger. A necklace I found among one of the Matrosen we picked up who didn't make it. And which reminds me what kind of German I really am. Ich konnte... I couldn't throw it away.
With Ziegler now gone for a while and things getting quiet, I felt like wearing it maybe and grübelte about it. But then I left it where Ferry could find it.
I was afraid he could be seen with it or me in the wrong Moment.
... May I see it?
Also gut. I'll show you. But you can't tell a soul, Kapitän!
On my honor.
*sigh* Here, that's my necklace.
Kapitän, every one of us Schiffsdamen were given those papers - though we have neither Blut nor parents. They even debattieren about amending the laws for us - this is Germany.
We like everything orderly. And serving in the Kriegsmarine as an Offizier means you need an Ariernachweis. Schiffsdamen are Offiziere, so we all got issued one with our Wehrpässen.
Right. Well, your secret's safe with me. We don't want Ziegler back - or worse.
Can you bitte dismiss me? I would like to be allein now.
Of course. But if you ever want to talk...
Danke, Kapitän.
What a damn mess. She doesn't deserve to-
@BATTLE
I know. Officer Jin just reported a complete inventory.
Star of David? It's well made, I think. It suits you.
Of course, you've also got Aryan certification...
*ALARM*
Wait, Atlantis! Come back!
Seaman Brooks, do you have that bracket attached yet?
I can't find the bolts. Where did you put them?
They were on the deck right behind you.
Are these the bolts you need?
Thanks, Cap.
Hey, Officer Raleigh, I found them! No thanks to you...

Fields.MenuText: Quit fighting. Just get the work done.
You didn't find the bolts, Seaman Brooks. I did.
Let me guess. Atlantis put you up to this.

Fields.DialogueText: You heard the Captain, Seaman Brooks.
Ha!
That's right, Captain. Atlantis seemed excited about it... So, hurry up, Seaman Brooks.
I see a lot of gear lying about on the deck. Whatever you're building is going to be big.
Atlantis wants us to install this extra funnel... and an extra mast, too.
Finally! It looks like Atlantis is going to show us what she can do.
What SHE can do?! That's funny. I thought I was the one putting in all the bolts.
*ALARM*
Get to your battle stations.
It's your lucky day, Seaman Brooks. Some Morganas are going to give you a break from turning that wrench.
Yeah, yeah.
@BATTLE
Yeah, yeah.
Yeah, yeah.
Yeah, yeah.
Take a good look, Kapitän, and tell me what you think.
I'm glad to see everything finally assembled. When all of that gear came out of storage, it cluttered up the deck just lying around.
I didn't mean the Deck. Look up at our new... Arrangement.
Ah! Good work, Atlantis. The extra mast and the fake funnel are very clever.
Ja, it's a special capability of ours. Changing our Konfiguration makes us look different to other Schiffe.
Like a disguise.
Das stimmt. When a lookout on another Schiff sees us, they don't see us. They see something else.

Fields.MenuText: It could make us anonymous.
We could imitate another ship.
I wonder if we could impersonate a Morgana ship.

Fields.DialogueText: Anonym, ja. But, with a little work, we can do even better than that.
Precisely my Intention...
Oh! I admit, I had not thought of that myself. It could be possible irgendwann...
My Intention is to make us appear as a different Schiff. This Technik can allow us to approach sensitive targets without arousing suspicion or revealing our true Identität.
In fact, we can rearrange the false Aufbauten to create multiple profiles, not just one.
From far away, it could work. But, up close...
You're scharfsinnig. I like how you antizipierst the strategic concerns, Kapitän.
Thanks, Atlantis.
That said, I have already started to work on those Details. Komm down below and I will show you what I'm working on.
I'm excited to see it...
*ALARM*
... but first things first!
Ich bin bereit, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
Captain! Out of nowhere... Captain, I... I don't know HOW he got on board, but...
Slow down and breathe.
Never saw another ship... but... out of nowhere...
Officer Jin, I can't understand you like this.
Another captain... another captain came aboard, Captain.
Oh?
And, we have absolutely no idea how he got here.

Fields.MenuText: A visit from another officer is a nice surprise. Where is he?
Remind me to talk to the sergeant-at-arms about security later.
I doubt it. Let me guess – nobody saw the visitor and our Belle in the same room together.

Fields.DialogueText: On the bridge, but he said he was coming down here to your cabin.
Should I have the crew repel boarders?
Now that you mention it...
Greetings, Kapitan! Kapitan Ivanov at your service!
Oh, really? Kapitan Ivanov, you say? Then welcome aboard...
Spasibo! Thank you for the warm welcome!
Who's this? A Russian kapitan?
Ne Russkiy?
*ALARM*
Get to battle stations.
Aye aye, Captain.
Yes, Captain!
Was that fun, Atlantis?
Fun, you say?
Vielleicht just a little bit.
You have to help me unscramble Officer Jin's brain after the fight.
@BATTLE
No need. I don't think we have anything to fear from our visitor.
I hope my recent Demonstration wasn't too disruptive.
You mean showing off your disguises and tricking Officer Jin? It did cause a stir.
Es ist bedauerlich if it caused any distress, but I did it for a wichtigen reason, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: You just wanted to flaunt your skills a bit.
You showed us the kind of tactical advantage a good disguise can be.
You taught Officer Jin what happens when people let down their guard.

Fields.DialogueText: That was most certainly not my Intention, Kapitän!
Officer Jin saw me in the guise of another officer – never thinking the Schiff might be in danger.
Officer Jin let a "stranger" roam the Brücke... And even walk to your cabin.
People tend to see what they want to see. What they expect to see.
You chose a good time for your exhibition.
We've trained the crew to recognize ships by their features... As well as how to manipulate our own. This was the next step.
Genau. You got it in one.
You must have something in mind.
You lernst to read me quite well, Kapitän. I...
*ALARM*
You had something more to say?
Hold that thought for me.
Jawohl, Kapitän. After we deal with this Kampf.
@BATTLE
Excellent training report, Atlantis. The crew's getting faster at installing and moving the fake masts around.
We can still be more effizient, especially with installing the funnel.
You've been drilling them hard, and they're improving.
What's more impressive is that they are executing all of your drills without complaint.
Oh?

Fields.MenuText: Clearly, they respect you. They would follow you into danger.
Our crew trusts you. They have confidence your plans.
I think the crew likes you more than me.

Fields.DialogueText: A Schiffsdame and her Kapitän could not ask a crew for anything more than that.
Schön!
What a strange thing to be envious of, Kapitän.
I couldn't help but notice something else. Atlantis, I don't want to upset you by saying so, but...
Ja?
... But you seemed more comfortable when you had on a disguise.
I take no pleasure in deceiving people, Kapitän.
That's not what I meant.
I meant that you look more relaxed in somebody else's skin.
Does that really surprise you? You know why I keep my Ariernachweis closer than others, Kapitän.
I can't change that for you, Atlantis.
For the crew to put their full faith in someone like me, a German Jüdin...
The crew admires you for what you do. Don't go looking for an excuse to disappoint them.
I will try my best.
The crew is waiting for me in the mess. I need to help them with their Kostümuniformern.
Right after we handle this...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
It's a little bit sad that this is so much easier than getting INPF uniforms. Still, more power to you.
Officer Raleigh, that paint is still not the right color. The Grün needs to be lighter.
Are you sure? Then I guess I'll add some gray paint.
Lighter, not darker. Try adding weiße paint.
White paint. Right, right...
Paint? Are you changing the color of our hull?
Nein. The paint is actually for one of our seaplanes.
We're changing the plane's paint Schema to make it look like a Japanisches aircraft.

Fields.MenuText: But, I don't think any Japanese ships are operating in our area right now.
Great! I always liked the look of Japanese planes.
Clever...

Fields.DialogueText: That's the Idee, Kapitän.
I admire them, too... But I am not repainting our plane just to make it more ästhetisch pleasing.
I'm glad you approve.
If observers see a Japanisches plane, they might assume that a Japanisches ship – or perhaps even a task force – was operating here.
That would cause a bit of confusion.
I'm hoping it causes enough Konfusion for what I have in mind.
Get a brief ready for me as soon as you can.
Jawohl, Kapitän.
*ALARM*
Right after we deal with this Einmischung!
@BATTLE
Our hull configuration is set, and we have stationed topside personnel in their costume uniforms, Captain.
Excellent, Officer Jin. If any Morganas spotted us here before, they won't recognize us now.
Our seaplane has launched safely, Kapitän.
Our painted one?
Flying with Japanischen colors. The pilot has been instructed to fly low enough to be spotted.
You're forgetting one last thing.
Ah! Sehr richtig!
Arigato for the reminder, Captain.
Sato-taisa, commander of the Empire's finest heavy cruiser!
Incredible...

Fields.MenuText: What?! Sato? Where did Atlantis go? Bring her back!
Nobody will believe a ship of our size is a heavy cruiser, no matter how many fake masts we assemble.
It's still you in there, Atlantis... right?

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Very funny, Kanchou. You know it's me, Atlantis.
Show some confidence, Kanchou! I can be quite convincing.
Hai. Honto desu ne, Kanchou. It's still me, Atlantis.
I'm heading to the radio room, Captain.
Good. Let me know as soon as we intercept any communications.
Aye aye, Captain.
Ready to get started?
Hai.
Engines all ahead full. Time for us to be seen.
@BATTLE
Mind your helm. Keep us running close to the shore, not onto it. I'd rather not run aground today.
Ja, Kapitän... But, I want to make sure we are close enough to be noticed.
I just realized something...

Fields.MenuText: You're probably anxious about operating this close to land. German HQ never let you do it before.
You've probably been eager to make a run at the coast ever since we got rid of Ziegler.
Are you self-conscious about being seen?

Fields.DialogueText: I have to get adjusted to the Idee of not being ashamed of it, ja.
I don't exactly like hearing that Name again, but you are right.
I am not afraid of it. Immerhin, things are different now.
Seit you helped me get rid of that Pest Ziegler, I have enjoyed having more freedom.
Captain, we've intercepted radio transmissions from local marine traffic. They include reports about a Japanese seaplane and a Japanese heavy Crusier!
Anything about a certain German auxiliary cruiser?
Nothing, Captain.
Excellent.
Then it's time for the area to see the rest of the "Japanese" battle group.
That‘s my Zeichen.
Min'na-san, yoku mite kudasai. We know you're watching... Come and get a good look at us, Funayūrei...
We've got Morganas on the horizon. Let's give them more than just a good look.
@BATTLE
After the last engagement, we intercepted scattered Morgana reports. We believe they are trying to rally reinforcements to tackle an unexpected Japanese battle group.
That should take some attention away from the civilian vessels for now. The Morganas were hitting the merchants here pretty hard.
I am glad we were able to help the merchants for a Weile, but those Schabracken will eventually come back with greater numbers.
We need a way to get rid of them for a longer amount of time.

Fields.MenuText: The Morganas won't ever back down. They're fearless.
The Morganas will chase anything. We could try to lure them away.
The Morganas need to think we have overwhelming numbers.

Fields.DialogueText: The nixe – the Morganas – are aggressive... But selten foolhardy. We might be able to intimidate them with...
Ein cleverer Plan. With more time it might work, but I'm afraid my top speed of 17 Knoten is going to be a Problem. How about...
Das ist es! Let's show them more than a Japanische battle group. Let's show them...
... eine multi-nationale Task Force.
Maybe it's about time for the Americans to join in! Captain Jones, reporting for duty!
I have an idea. We can paint our other seaplane...
... To look American?
Why not think even bigger? If we hurry, we could paint it to look British!
A coordinated task force with a big mix of naval forces? That's my personal specialty!
I'll get on the radio and start broadcasting battle group commands. Even though it's all make-believe, those Morganas might fall for it.
Full of surprises, Atlantis. Or rather, "Captain Jones."
If I'm reading our radar screen correctly, we've got an opportunity! Let's assault this horde of Morganas to the west, and get their main group's attention. Yee-haw!
@BATTLE
... That last bit might've been a bit excessive.
Great work, Atlantis!
The Morganas don't know what they're dealing with, amid all the  Japanese, Russian, British, American and German ships.
We're locken them away from the major waterways. Quite a false flag operation.
With a LOT of false flags!
An accomplishment our crew should take great pride in achieving, Kapitän.
That is, if this pack of Morganas does not sink us here.

Fields.MenuText: We definitely stirred up a hornet's nest.
Maybe our tricks worked a little too well.
Steady as she goes, Atlantis. I know we can hold them off.

Fields.DialogueText: We are more than Tricks and Irreführung, Kapitän. We have our guns, too.
I've never been accused of being too effektiv before. I'll have to take that as a Kompliment.
Jawohl, Kapitän. If you say we will, we will!
The Morgana pack chasing us does have us outnumbered – but they are still confused. If we can keep them off balance, we should be able to win the day.
The crew and I trust you for a reason, Atlantis.
@BATTLE
I have good news and bad news, Kapitän.
Bad news first.
During our Gefecht to fend off the Morganas, we sustained hits to our disguise funnel and one of our extra Masten.
Beide structures were blown off and lost in the Wasser.
I can guess the good news, then.
We don't have to worry about disassembling our disguise before we return to port.
Ha!
I was eigentlich to say that our good news was "no sign of pursuing Morganas," but I'm sure Seaman Brooks would agree with your observation.
You suddenly got a serious look on your face, Atlantis. Are you all right?
Ich habe nur... just thinking about returning to port.
You've earned a rest, and don't pretend we don't need the repairs.
I've grown accustomed to life at sea with you and the crew. The further at sea we went, the less I had to deal with German authorities - people like Ziegler.
I had to check my pockets to make sure my Ariernachweis was still there.

Fields.MenuText: Play the cards you're dealt. That's all we can do right now.
Why not disguise yourself more often? You could fool German HQ easily.
When HQ reads our mission debrief, you'll get more respect.

Fields.DialogueText: Perhaps after the Krieg it will be easier. I would love to do some exploring. But, for now at least, the Krieg is real and cannot be ignored.
I've been tempted to do so before, but it would be wrong to deceive the Vaterland.
That would be wunderbar! However, I hope you cleared the reports of any hints about my.... kulturellen mannerisms.
I do have one Option. I will endeavour to imitate you, Kapitän.
You're going to be my doppelganger? Walking around with my face and voice? I'm not sure how I feel about that.
Nein! Not for copying your appearance. I want to emulate the way you think.
You have herausgefunden how to accept me. If I kopiere that behavior, I can accept myself, too.
I think I'll take that as a compliment, then. How does that saying go? "Imitation is the highest form of flattery" or something like that?
Lob und Anerkennung was intended, Kapitän. Praise.
I consider you not just a capable Offizier and my Kapitän, but also... My friend.
I feel the same way, Atlantis. You have a unique talent, and you're always trying to do your best for your crew and country.
We'll get through our time in port together, and then we'll find out what else we can accomplish together. How does that sound to you?
Wunderbar, mein Freund!
Morganas closing! One last push, Atlantis...
@BATTLE
